Package controller

Class InitScreenController

java.lang.Object
controller.InitScreenController
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.event.DocumentListener
public class InitScreenController
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, javax.swing.event.DocumentListener
Class providing the controller for the processes related to setting up the board: specifying the dimensions and the locations of the beacon tiles, pit tiles, and the gold tile

Note that, although the back-end implementation uses a zero-based index, the front-end (user-facing) follows a one-based index in line with the machine project specifications.

  • Constructor Summary

    Creates a controller object with the initialization screen GUI and the game master as parameters

    • checkInput

      public boolean checkInput​(java.lang.String inputSize, java.lang.String inputGold, java.lang.String inputBeacons, java.lang.String inputPits)
      Returns true if the user input is logical and in conformity with the format recognized by the system; false, otherwise

      This method also parses the input and displays the appropriate error message as needed, informing the user of the nature of the malformed input.

      Note that, although the back-end implementation uses a zero-based index, the front-end (user-facing) follows a one-based index in compliance with the machine project specifications.

      Parameters:
      inputSize - dimension of the board
      inputGold - coordinates of the gold square tile
      inputBeacons - coordinates of the beacons
      inputPits - coordinates of the pits
      Returns:
      true if the user input is logical and in conformity with the format recognized by the system; false, otherwise
